title: How to Create a Battery Tester

steps.headline: Get some enameled copper wire or wire obtained from the inside of a tube light choke.
Wind the wire over a tumbler and remove, so that it takes the form of a spiral.
Attach the spiral together by a string at two or more places, leaving the ends open, and fix it vertically over a board.
Tie a razor blade (or any lightweight, conductive metal) with a string horizontally and hang it at the top of the wound coil such that the blade is parallel to the coil.
Connect the two ends of the coil to any torch or other battery.
steps.description: The blade should deflect if there is current in it. If not deflected then it is a waste battery.

text: Get some enameled copper wire or wire obtained from the inside of a tube light choke. Don't worry about the length. Wind the wire over a tumbler and remove, so that it takes the form of a spiral.  Attach the spiral together by a string at two or more places, leaving the ends open, and fix it vertically over a board.  Tie a razor blade (or any lightweight, conductive metal) with a string horizontally and hang it at the top of the wound coil such that the blade is parallel to the coil.  Connect the two ends of the coil to any torch or other battery. The blade should deflect if there is current in it. If not deflected then it is a waste battery.
